intro: Trachyrhachis erinacea, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other members like nettles and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, and its stems are often hairy as well. Trachyrhachis erinacea is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
